page.title: 10Cheam School,Headley
page.content: The building dates from the mid 1860's and was a country house known as{Beenham Court.}The original school moved here from{Cheam,Surrey}in 1934 The school was founded by G.Aldrich, the first headmaster.The present headmaster is C.Evers M.A. Boys aged 8_13 years attend as boarders and are taught Maths,French, English,Latin,Science,History,Music, Geography,Scripture,Computers and Art. These are taught by a staff of 15 full time tutors and 5 visiting tutors. Facilities include 12 classrooms,18 dormitories,Computer,Music,Art,French and Geography rooms,Science labs,Tuck Shop,Chapel,Library & Carpentry Shop. Sporting facilities for Football, Rugby,Cricket,Shooting,Tennis,Bowls, Crochet,Squash and Swimming are available in the 30 acres of playing fields and the Sports hall.
